level.text: Notwithstanding instances when manual tabulation is required by law or this chapter, the Board may order that ballots be manually inspected and tabulated under the following circumstances:

Upon the filing of a recount petition, when it appears that a disproportionate number of potential undervotes or overvotes have occurred in a particular precinct, or to determine whether write-in votes have been cast that affect vote totals for candidates whose names are pre-printed on the ballot;
When there is evidence of a machine miscount or malfunction; or
When it is determined by the Board that manual tabulation is necessary to ascertain correct vote totals.
When manual tabulation is ordered pursuant to this section:
Validity of ballots and votes and tabulation procedures shall conform to the rules specified in this chapter;
Only the ballots for those precincts and contests designated by the Board shall be manually tabulated; and
The Board shall direct that the tabulation be conducted at a time that is practicable.
